awards.title: Dorian Powell Prize  (2014/2015)
awards.description:
Second male in the history of the award to receive it. 

A committee comprised of lecturers (Dr. Leith Dunn - IGDS; Dr. Ramona Biholar -  Faculty of Law; and Mr. Clement Branch - Human Resource Management Department), reviews academic results, and prepares a shortlist of candidates who are then interviewed. One individual is select as the recipient of the award.
awards.issuer: Institute for Gender and Development Studies (IGDS), Mona Campus

awards.title: Fair Play Award of Excellence 2014/2015 (Second Runners-Up)
awards.description:
Journalists submit their published work for scrutiny by a panel of veteran journalists and communicators. The judges work independently and then their scores are compiled, and the winners chosen. There are three awards. Criticisms are also offered upon presentation by the representative of the panel. 

Global Reports/Eighteen Degrees North, which I completed an internship with won third place for the investigative series on the May 2010 Tivoli Incursion in Kingston Jamaica. The two-part episode was called "Ordered to Kill?"
awards.issuer: Jamaica Broilers Group

projects.title: CARIMAC Times 2016: The JREAM Edition
projects.description:
This edition has been designated ‘JREAM’ - Journalists Reviving Awareness of what Matters – marking the end of a yearlong process of scrutinizing many a social issue and carrying out toilsome but worthwhile research. It is the first time that an acronym has been used to identify the publication. This is primarily to allow for that identifier to go beyond the function of a title. ‘JREAM’ is also an assumed philosophy, which recognises the criticality of journalists as agenda setters. 

This magazine is a collection of in-depth stories, which highlight realities under six main themes: Abuse, Minorities, Public Health, Education, Economy, with an emphasis on youth, and Environment. 

The JREAM Edition is now live on three digital interactive magazine publishing and hosting platforms, and the best part is - it is FREE! You may read it whenever you please from personal digital devices. See the details below:

OPTION 1: Joomag at http://joom.ag/7QCQ
OPTION 2: ISSUU at https://issuu.com/thenow/docs/carimac_times_2016
OPTION 3: Yumpu at https://www.yumpu.com/s/QKSZ5hBakXf1DoLg

Enjoy!!

profile_positions.description:
As advertised: 
- Copy-edit a wide variety of English communications (brochures, emails, web content, newsletters, job descriptions, social media posts), ensuring that the end product is in correct and compelling British English.
- Work with the Communications Manager to ensure an efficient copy-editing review process and seek out ways to improve English communications company wide.
- Copy-write British English texts (internal newsletters, emails, web and brochure content).
- Take on communications projects, for example: Work with the Learning and Training Manager to edit all training materials.
- Serve as the back-up of Communications Manager.
profile_positions.title: English Copy Editor and Copy Writer

profile_positions.description:
Assisted with research into May 2010 Tivoli Incursion in West Kingston, Jamaica, in preparation for a two part episode (mini documentary) "Ordered to Kill?" of the TV Magazine program.

Did primary and secondary research
Collated data from several documents and created spread sheets with data.
